alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 5:28AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG AND PATCHY FROST DURING THE COMMUTE THIS MORNING... Shallow dense fog has developed along much of the Lower Columbia, Cowlitz, and Willamette Rivers early this morning, reducing visibility to as low as a few hundred feet in some locations. The dense fog is impacting portions of the Interstate 5 corridor in southwest Washington, the Vancouver metro area, as well as much of North and Northeast Portland. Fog is less widespread elsewhere in the Portland metro area. In addition to the fog, temperatures near freezing are leading to locally frosty roads across the greater Portland and Vancouver metro area, especially where it has remained clear. Drivers involved in this morning`s commute should be prepared for locally slick roads and rapid changes in visibility. Fog and frost will diminish within a couple hours after sunrise.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County
